Html:
How can I write with InputSimulator spanish word like (Sánchez)?

Thank you

You can use the SimulateTextEntry() method with that text verbatim. It supports the full Unicode character set supported on the version of Windows you are running.

Cheers,
Mike

Thank you for answering, It is not as you say, I test It, tried to write 'Sánchez' and It writes 'S?nchez'...

Why can It be like that?

Interesting. Could you try downloading the latest code revision from CodePlex here: http://inputsimulator.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/view/81064747a32a8322ef47641227426ab032b81fac

There's a suite of tests checking Unicode support. Let me know if that helps.

Cheers,
Mike

I had the similar problem with Cyrillic. All characters were ???. I tried the latest revision, and it fixed problem!
And all project became cleaner and handier. Great job, thank you!

Hey, great news. I just need to make/find time to get it on nuget.

Thanks!
Mike
